title: Splendor and Intimacy: Mughal and Rajput Courtly Life, Part 2
short_description: Exquisite miniature paintings and decorative arts, including jades, jewelry, and weapons, demonstrate the richness of the arts that were produced in South Asia between the 16th and 19th centuries. The selection of objects in this exhibition offers a glimpse into the courtly life of the Mughal emperors (1526–1857) as well as that of their Rajput opponents and vassals.

input: Splendor and Intimacy: Mughal and Rajput Courtly Life, Part 2
